p: Global HIV-1 eradication remains elusive with 1.8 million new infections in 2017, often associated with late diagnosis, gaps in linkage to care and incomplete viral suppression. The importance of a multipronged approach was emphasised with the need to improve ARV tolerability and convenience, thus maximising adherence as well as optimising pharmacokinetics and tissue distribution. These features are key to pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) effectiveness, a strategy known to prevent HIV-1 transmission that impacts on both its incidence and prevalence [26].
